posts.post_content:
There will be a mechanic in Avacyn Restored called miracle, which will allow you to play cards with this mechanic for an extremely reduced cost if they were the first cards you drew that turn. The first one spoiled ([Thunderous Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thunderous Wrath) - wait until AVR is released for the link to work) will allow you to deal 5 damage for 1 mana this way.
  
And it is going to be ridiculous when paired with this.

Posted By: Gelzo (12/12/2010 11:27:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Without splashing another color you can manipulate your next two draws. So very worth it in a burn deck. Too many times I've had four mana on the board, plenty enough for all my spells, and then drawn 3 lands.  
  
With this guy, I can make sure to throw those at the bottom of the deck, or at least increase the chance of getting my [Breaking Point](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Breaking Point) if I'm getting backed into a corner.
posts.html:
Without splashing another color you can manipulate your next two draws. So very worth it in a burn deck. Too many times I've had four mana on the board, plenty enough for all my spells, and then drawn 3 lands.

With this guy, I can make sure to throw those at the bottom of the deck, or at least increase the chance of getting my Breaking Point if I'm getting backed into a corner.

Posted By: Enelysios (3/26/2012 4:20:09 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I think this card is not so good as everyone seems to believe. Basically, you draw a bad card to avoid drawing another bad card in the next turn, plus it doesn't work every time. You're on turn 2, you play this and scry. You find a grim lavamancer and a land, so you put them in bottom library because you already have a lavamancer on the field and you don't need anymore lands. Next turn you draw a land. Or, you scry just to find out you have two lightning bolt so playing magma jet was unnecessary in the first place. Either way, you spent 2 mana, a card and dealt only 2 damage which is horrible for an aggressive deck. It wouldn't be so bad if it costed 1, but 2 mana means you can't play anything else on your second turn and if you're playing very aggressive this can doom you. I just prefer to play fetchlands, they change your library every turn so your library order is not fixed plus they remove lands so you're less likely to draw one. Sure, they can remove a good draw and place an horri... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
